column4: Hedge fund manager spared prison for insider trading
column5: NEW YORK  March 1 A former hedge fund manager who admitted to trading on non-public information about various technology companies and became a cooperating witness in a wide-ranging insider trading investigation was spared prison on Tuesday by a federal judge.

column4: U.S. fines Qualcomm for hiring relatives of China officials: SEC
column5: Qualcomm Inc has agreed to pay $7.5 million to settle charges it violated U.S. anti-bribery laws by hiring relatives of Chinese officials to obtain business  the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission said on Tuesday.

column4: BRIEF-Qualcomm enters into settlement with U.S. SEC
